author: Liam Knox, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump administration threatened to assume ownership of hundreds of millions of dollars worth of patents from Harvard University, accusing the Ivy League college of failing to comply with the law on federal research grants.
title: Trump Administration Threatens to Seize Valuable Harvard Patents

author: Joe Mayes
description: The UK arrested hundreds of people in a clampdown on migrants working illegally as drivers for delivery firms, as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s push to stem the flow of irregular immigration.
title: UK Arrests Hundreds of People in Clampdown on Illegal Delivery Rider Work

author: Josh Sisco
description: Greystar Real Estate Partners LLC reached a tentative settlement with the Department of Justice in an antitrust lawsuit accusing the landlord of colluding to increase rents across the US, in part, through widely used industry software.
title: Greystar Reaches Deal in US Justice Department’s Rental Market Collusion Case

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Colombia’s biggest cocaine cartel will sit down with government negotiators as President Gustavo Petro seeks peace deals with the nation’s illegal armed groups before he leaves office next year.
title: Colombia’s Biggest Cocaine Cartel to Talk Peace With Government

author: Laurence Arnold
description: William Webster, the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency and, very briefly, the first head of the US accounting oversight board, has died. He was 101.
title: William Webster, Only Person to Lead Both The FBI and CIA, Dies at 101

author: Chris Strohm
description: President Donald Trump is threatening to have the federal government take over Washington, DC. However, his powers to take action inside the nation’s capital are limited. He’d need an act of Congress to have complete control.
title: Trump Is Threatening To Take Over DC. Can He Do It?

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: The Trump administration asked a federal judge to throw out a lawsuit filed by Harvard University over a proposed ban on international students, saying the president has the broad authority to issue rules restricting the entry of non-citizens into the country.
title: Trump DOJ Asks Judge to Dismiss Harvard Foreign Student Suit

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Naureen S Malik
description: President Donald Trump is preparing to tap David Rosner to be chair of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, which oversees key decisions about natural gas export terminals and power lines.
title: Trump to Tap Biden Appointee to Lead US Agency Overseeing Natural Gas Exports

author: Ben Holland
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics and politics editor Ben Holland looks at the past week’s progress toward a Trump-Putin summit. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump-Putin Summit Looms Closer But Still Lacks Detail

author: Alex Vasquez, Carolina Millan, Matthew Bristow
description: The US under President Donald Trump is crafting a confrontational approach toward Latin America that signals a willingness to use military force against drug cartels, discarding the Biden administration’s preference for carrots over sticks to coax countries into alignment with US interests.
title: Trump Rattles Latin America by Weighing Using Military Force

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Donald Trump announced that he plans to meet “very shortly” with Russian President Vladimir Putin, as the US president looks to broker a ceasefire agreement in hopes of bringing an end to the war in Ukraine.
title: Trump Announces He Plans to Meet With Putin ‘Very Shortly’

author: Liam Knox, Maxwell Adler
description: The Trump administration is seeking more than $1 billion from the University of California at Los Angeles in exchange for releasing $584 million in federal research funding that the US froze last week.
title: Trump Wants UCLA to Pay $1 Billion to Unfreeze Research Funds

author: Alicia Clanton
description: California Lieutenant Governor Eleni Kounalakis has dropped her campaign for governor and will instead run for state treasurer next year.
title: Eleni Kounalakis Drops Out of California Governor’s Race

author: Dawn Lim
description: The private equity industry has a novel bedfellow in a White House executive order that will pave the way for American workers’ 401(k) savings to go beyond stocks and bonds.
title: Private Equity Is Torn Over Being Lumped In With Crypto in 401(k) Order

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Former Representative Billy Long, a Republican from Missouri and commissioner of the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) nominee for US President Donald Trump, left, on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, April 29, 2025. Ethics filings reveal connections between Long and companies promoting a pandemic-era credit associated with fraud and tribal tax credits the Treasury Department has said is not authorized by law or regulation.
title: IRS Commissioner Billy Long to Depart, With Bessent Now Acting Head

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Daniel Carvalho
description: The odds that Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro will back Tarcisio de Freitas as a candidate in next year’s presidential election are fading, his allies say, a blow to investors who see the Sao Paulo governor as the ideal challenger to leftist Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.
title: Bolsonaro Unlikely to Back Investor Favorite in Brazil Vote

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration suggested it would issue a new policy clarifying that imports of gold bars should not face tariffs, after the government stunned traders by ruling that they would be subject to duties.
title: White House to Clarify Misinformation on Gold Tariffs

author: Brian Platt
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government announced a major pay increase for military members, a move that pushes Canada closer to meeting its NATO defense spending target.
title: Carney Raises Soldiers’ Pay, Moving Canada Closer to NATO Target

author: Brendan Murray
description: The World Trade Organization predicted subdued global merchandise trade this year and next, saying activity remains clouded by President Donald Trump’s tariffs on US imports, while lifting its estimate for 2025.
title: WTO Sees Less Severe Global Trade Slowdown Amid US Front-Loading

author: Martin Z Braun, Laura Nahmias
description: New York state’s cumulative three-year budget gap has swelled to $34 billion, rising 25% from Governor Kathy Hochul’s estimate in January as federal funding slows, Comptroller Thomas DiNapoli said.
title: New York Warns of $34 Billion Budget Hole, Biggest Since 2009 Crisis

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Myles Miller
description: The Department of Justice is investigating New York Attorney General Letitia James over the $454 million civil fraud case she won against President Donald Trump before he was elected.
title: DOJ Opens Investigation Into NY AG Letitia James Over Trump Suit

author: Wojciech Moskwa, Maciej Martewicz
description: Poland’s new President Karol Nawrocki announced plans to cut taxes for families with children, piling pressure on the country’s bloated budget and setting the stage for another clash with the government.
title: Poland’s New President Challenges Premier With Plan to Cut Taxes

author: Advait Palepu, Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi invited Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit the South Asian nation amid deteriorating relations with the US.
title: India’s Modi Invites Russia’s Putin to Visit Amid US Tensions

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal appeals court threw out a judge’s finding of “probable cause” to hold Trump administration officials in criminal contempt of court for sending accused Venezuelan gang members to an El Salvador prison despite his order to halt the deportations.
title: US Court Ends Contempt Proceeding in Trump Deportations Fight

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s most powerful drug traffickers, extortionists and kidnappers will be allowed to keep as much as 12% of their criminal profits in exchange for handing in their weapons under a controversial new bill intended to reduce violence.
title: Warlords Who Surrender Can Keep 12% of Profits in Colombia Plan

author: Gerson Freitas Jr, Erin Ailworth
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly said he loves farmers. His actions, though, are rippling across the agriculture industry as tariffs raise the cost of everything from tractors to fertilizers and squeeze profits for US growers already contending with low crop prices.
title: Tariffs Are Starting to Squeeze Profits for Trump-Loving Farmers

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Alberto Nardelli, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Washington and Moscow are aiming to reach a deal to halt the war in Ukraine that would lock in Russia’s occupation of territory seized during its military invasion, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: US and Russia Plan Truce Deal to Cement Putin’s Gains in Ukraine

author: Alex Vasquez, Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada is working to reset its ties with Mexico as Donald Trump threatens his neighbors with punishing US tariffs ahead of a planned review of the North American free-trade pact.
title: Carney Is Patching Up Ties With Mexico in Face of Trump Threats

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Skylar Woodhouse, Eric Martin
description: President Donald Trump will meet the leaders of Azerbaijan and Armenia to sign a joint peace declaration aimed at ending decades of war at a White House meeting Friday, as well as pacts giving the US rights to develop a transit route through the South Caucasus.
title: Trump to Sign Peace Deal to End Armenia, Azerbaijan Fighting

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s top court clarified rules on how to elect the parliamentary speaker, aiming to break a months-long political deadlock that’s prevented a cabinet from being formed and blocked the distribution of state funds.
title: Kosovo’s Top Court Sets Rules to Break Parliamentary Deadlock

author: Taonga Mitimingi
description: A South African court ruled that former Zambian President Edgar Lungu should be buried in his home country, a judgment that follows weeks of legal wrangling over what should happen to his remains.
title: Ex-Zambian Leader Should Be Buried in Home Country, Court Rules

author: Vlad Savov
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping is glad to see the US and Russia talking, he told Vladimir Putin in a phone conversation on Friday.
title: Xi Tells Putin He’s Glad to See Attempt at Improving US Ties

author: Arne Delfs
description: Germany will halt deliveries to Israel of military equipment that could be used in operations in the Gaza Strip, taking the step over concern for humanitary suffering in the territory.
title: Germany to Halt Military Deliveries to Israel for Gaza Attacks

author: Augusta Saraiva, Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Francisco González Galé didn’t expect to feel so at home when he fulfilled his kids’ wishes earlier this year by traveling to Walt Disney World in Orlando from Buenos Aires. The 46-year-old Argentine lawyer used to fly to the US once every couple of years, but he’s already been stateside twice in 2025.
title: Messi, Milei and Mickey Mouse Are Driving Argentine Tourists to US

author: Colum Murphy
description: China said its imports of Russian oil are justified, pushing back against US threats of new tariffs after Washington slapped secondary levies on India for buying energy from Moscow.
title: China Defends Buying Russian Oil After Trump’s Tariff Threat

author: Philip Heijmans, Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand and Cambodia on Thursday agreed to a set of measures to help maintain peace along their border after clashes last month killed more than 40 people and displaced 300,000.
title: ‘Godbrothers’ Fallout Hangs Over Fragile Thai-Cambodia Truce

author: Faseeh Mangi
description: Islamabad is reveling in an unexpected turnaround in US relations.
title: Pakistan Enjoys a Trump High as India Sweats

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The Philippine Supreme Court’s decision that invalidated the impeachment complaint against Vice President Sara Duterte did not determine the merits of the case but merely faulted the procedure, according to President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
title: Marcos Says Court Order Has No Bearing on Merits of VP Duterte’s Impeachment Case

author: Dan Williams, Galit Altstein
description: Israel said it will take control of Gaza City — a move that could displace 1 million Palestinians living there — defying domestic concerns over the fate of the remaining hostages and an international outcry over the humanitarian situation in the enclave.
title: Israel to Seize Gaza City, Stopping Short of Full Takeover

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Anto Antony, Peter Martin, Dan Strumpf
description: In the weeks after India and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire in May, officials in New Delhi seethed over Donald Trump’s claims that he brokered an end to a four-day armed conflict.
title: Trump Upends Decades of US Policy With Tariff Threats on India

author: Taylan Bilgic
description: A Turkish court ruled to block the popular YouTube channel of Fatih Altayli, an independent journalist arrested on charges of threatening President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
title: Turkey to Block Veteran Journalist’s YouTube Channel After Arrest

author: Lucy White
description: Homelessness Minister Rushanara Ali quit the UK government after the i Paper reported that she evicted four tenants from a house she owned and then increased the rent.
title: UK Homelessness Minister Quits Amid Renter Eviction Allegations

author: Weilun Soon, Sarah Chen, Rong Wei Neo
description: Washington’s efforts to choke Russian oil flows to India are raising the question of what will happen to the millions of barrels a day that would otherwise have been headed to the subcontinent.
title: China Is Key to Displaced Russian Oil’s Impact on Global Prices

author: Katia Dmitrieva
description: President Donald Trump’s “reciprocal” tariffs aim to level the playing field in global trade by imposing duties based on where a product is made.
title: Why a Product’s Country of Origin Matters in Trump’s Trade War

author: Mishal Husain
description: The women’s rights advocate says the international community’s failure to use its leverage is making the Taliban bolder.
title: Nargis Nehan: ‘We All Share Responsibility’ for Failure in Afghanistan

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is set to take further criticism from his own party in a plenary meeting that began Friday, following a dismal result in an upper house election last month that has weakened his mandate and triggered some internal momentum to replace him as leader.
title: Japan PM Ishiba Faces Heat from Party as Leadership at Risk

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: China’s Foreign Ministry on Friday said it has “lodged serious protests” with the Philippines over President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.’s comments on Taiwan.
title: China Protests Philippine President Marcos’ Remarks on Taiwan

author: Ray Ndlovu
description: Zimbabwe and the UK are rekindling diplomatic ties after almost three decades of tension, driven by a global surge in demand for critical minerals that’s led the former colonial power to pursue $1 billion in deals with the resource-rich nation.
title: UK Resets Ties With Zimbabwe in Push for Critical Minerals

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump moved to increase the presence of federal police around Washington, DC, a day after suggesting he could act to seize control of the capital city.
title: Trump Surges Federal Police to Patrol DC After Floating Takeover

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: A Bank of Japan board member hinted that the BOJ may be moving toward another rate hike by the end of the year depending on the impact from US tariffs, according to a summary of opinions from the bank’s policy meeting last week.
title: BOJ May Exit Wait-and-See Mode by End of This Year, Summary Says
